info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 30 at 2:50AM CST until November 30 at 12:00PM CST by NWS La Crosse WI
info.description:
...WINTER WEATHER IMPACTS CONTINUE THIS MORNING...
.Light to moderate snow continues this morning with slippery travel and visibility impacts across the region. Breezy winds of 20 to 35 mph will lead to periods of blowing snow, especially west of the Mississippi River, resulting in further reductions to visibility at times. Light snowfall and breezy winds linger into the late morning and will prolong the already difficult travel conditions, primarily for areas along and south of Interstate 90. Snowfall and winds begin to diminish from west to east by the afternoon as the winter storm moves out of the region.
* WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph.
* WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Iowa and southeast Minnesota.
* WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 6 AM CST early this morning. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 AM this morning to noon CST today.
* IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Iowa, visit 511ia.org for road conditions. In Minnesota, visit 511mn.org for road conditions. In Wisconsin, visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

parameter.value: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO NOON CST TODAY
